title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
The U.S. trade deficit increased 27% last year to an all-time high of $859.1 billion, underscoring the strength of the nation's economy and its continued hefty dependence on imports from China and other countries.

Americans took on more new debt in 2021 than in any year since before the 2008-09 financial crisis.

---

Peloton is replacing its CEO and cutting about 2,800 jobs after a slowdown in demand caused the company's value to plummet.

---

SoftBank CEO Son is playing salesman for an initial public offering of Arm after a deal to sell the chip designer to Nvidia fell apart.

---

A judge dismissed part of the criminal case against an ex-Boeing pilot accused of misleading regulators about faulty software that played a significant role in two deadly 737 MAX crashes.

---

U.S. stocks rose, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow gaining 0.8% 1.3% and 1.1%, respectively.

---

Ford and GM are clamping down on dealerships that are trying to charge more than the sticker price amid a shortage of cars.

---

Pfizer forecast strong sales this year for its Covid-19 vaccine and treatment and is hunting for deals to bolster its pipeline of experimental products.

---

BP sought to reassure investors that declining oil-and-gas production won't cripple earnings for the remainder of the decade as it pivots to lower-carbon investments.
